item.title: PowerShell Notes
item.description: There are two categories of PowerShell command: External Command: For example, CMD commands, or programs launched from PowerShell. Output is in plain text. They run as separate processes to PowerShell. Native Command: These are relatively easy to discover, as all can be listed within the PowerShell command line. These return objects, not just text. Commands have a naming convention and format. Native commands typically follow this format: Command-Name -Parameter Value Searching for PowerShell Commands We can get a list of native PowerShell commands with Get-Command.
